eu.opends.visualization

Class LightningClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.opends.visualization.LightningClient

  • public class LightningClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a TCP client that connects to a given IP address and port in order to transmit the position and orientation of the current camera view. The required frame rate can be set in the constructor.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

      The constructor

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Closes the TCP connection to the server (if a connection could be established).

      void sendTrafficLightData(java.lang.String instructionString)
      This method sends the given traffic light data to the server immediately even if not enough time has passed by since last traffic light data was sent.

    • Method Detail

      • sendCameraData

        public void sendCameraData(com.jme3.renderer.Camera camera)

      • sendTrafficLightData

        public void sendTrafficLightData(java.lang.String instructionString)
        This method sends the given traffic light data to the server immediately even if not enough time has passed by since last traffic light data was sent. This method sends two strings (E.g. if there are three traffic lights):
        ltupdate .remotemotionsensor -trafficlightmodesIn {"red_left" "green_up" "red_right"}
        and
        ltupdate .remotemotionsensor -switchtrafficlightsIn 1

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the TCP connection to the server (if a connection could be established).
